etymology.description: Depicts leaves growing from a tree -> original form of 葉(叶) (yè, 'leaf') -> phonetically borrowed for 'flat'
etymology.interpretation: The character 枼(yè, 'leaf') visually resembles leaves sprouting from a tree, preserving its pictographic origin in 葉(叶) (yè, 'leaf'). Over time, it was also used phonetically to represent the concept of 'flat.'

examples.chinese: 树上的枼(樹上的葉)在微风中轻轻摇曳(在微風中輕輕搖曳)。
examples.pinyin: Shù shàng de yè zài wēifēng zhōng qīngqīng yáoyè.
examples.english: The leaves on the tree sway gently in the breeze.

examples.chinese: 秋天来临时(秋天來臨時)，枼纷纷飘落(葉紛紛飄落)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān láilín shí, yè fēnfēn piāoluò.
examples.english: When autumn arrives, the leaves fall one after another.

examples.chinese: 春雨滋润着枼(春雨滋潤著葉)，让花儿更显娇媚(讓花兒更顯嬌媚)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnyǔ zīrùn zhe yè, ràng huā ér gèng xiǎn jiāomèi.
examples.english: The spring rain nourishes the leaves, making the flowers appear even more charming.
